results.title: Love nest
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Jules Buck and Joseph Newman
results.brief_description: When serviceman Jim Scott (William Lundigan) returns home after 2 1/2 years in the Army he finds his wife, Connie (June Haver), has bought a run down apartment block and assumed the role of landlady at 337 Grammercy Place. Eager to resume his writing, he soon learns that the landlord is always home, and with a suspected Casanova swindler as a tenant, and a jealous wife following the arrival of Jim’s beautiful Army buddy WAC Bobby (Marilyn Monroe), it will take something exceptional to get his writing off the ground and save the decrepit building from being condemned. Cast also includes Frank Fay, Leatrice Joy and Jack Parr. Based on the novel by Scott Corbett. Includes the original theatrical trailer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Jules Buck and Joseph Newman
results.description: When serviceman Jim Scott (William Lundigan) returns home after 2 1/2 years in the Army he finds his wife, Connie (June Haver), has bought a run down apartment block and assumed the role of landlady at 337 Grammercy Place. results.title: Love My Way: What's In a Name
results.creator_credit: Southern Star Entertainment, Foxtel, Showtime, New South Wales Film and Television Office, John Edwards, Claudia Karvan, Tony McNamara and Jessica Hobbs
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 2 first aired on Foxtel on 22nd November, 2004.

group_siblings.creator_credit: Southern Star Entertainment, Foxtel, Showtime, New South Wales Film and Television Office, John Edwards, Claudia Karvan, Tony McNamara and Jessica Hobbs

results.title: Love My Way: My Family Up a Tree
results.creator_credit: Southern Star Entertainment, Foxtel, Showtime, New South Wales Film and Television Office, John Edwards, Claudia Karvan and Brendan Cowell
results.brief_description:
The groundbreaking, multiple award-winning drama series ‘Love My Way’ was one of the first Australian productions made exclusively for subscription television (Foxtel). This enabled Foxtel to allow the producers ‘absolute creative freedom…to carve out a piece of TV drama that was edgy, daring, provocative’ (Foxtel’s Brian Walsh).

Revolving around the untidy lives and complicated loves of a contemporary Australian blended family and their friends, ‘Love My Way’ was both critically acclaimed and highly successful, with a further two seasons produced following the initial ten episodes of Series 1.

Series 1, Episode 7 first aired on Foxtel on 10th January 2005.
